Package View_controller

Class MainScreenController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View_controller.MainScreenController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class MainScreenController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The MainScreenController class implements the Initializable class and houses all the methods and fields needed to give the application interactivity on the MainScreen application window.
    Author:
    JamesBundtrock

        Parameters:

        rb - The resources used to localize the root object, or null if the root object was not localized.

        Parameters:

      • searchPartInv

        private void searchPartInv​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Adds functionality to the partSearchButton and allows it to search for Part objects. Populates the partTable based off of a search of the inventory for the text inside the partSearchField TextField. First, it looks for and adds any partial or full matches based on the String name. Then it searches once more, if the input is a whole number, for a full match based on the int value of id. If no matches are found, an error message pops up to tell the user, and the table is filled with all part objects within the inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • searchProductInv

        private void searchProductInv​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Adds functionality to the productSearchButton and allows it to search for Product objects. Populates the productTable based off of a search of the inventory for the text inside the productSearchField TextField. First, it looks for and adds any partial or full matches based on the String name. Then it searches once more, if the input is a whole number, for a full match based on the int value of id. If no matches are found, an error message pops up to tell the user, and the table is filled with all product objects within the inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • onEnterKeyPart

        void onEnterKeyPart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Adds functionality to the partSearchField and allows it to search for Part objects when the enter key is pressed. Populates the partTable based off of a search of the inventory for the text inside the partSearchField TextField. First, it looks for and adds any partial or full matches based on the String name. Then it searches once more, if the input is a whole number, for a full match based on the int value of id. If no matches are found, an error message pops up to tell the user, and the table is filled with all part objects within the inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - An enter key press ideally

      • onEnterKeyProduct

        void onEnterKeyProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Adds functionality to the productSearchField and allows it to search for Product objects when the enter key is pressed. Populates the productTable based off of a search of the inventory for the text inside the productSearchField TextField. First, it looks for and adds any partial or full matches based on the String name. Then it searches once more, if the input is a whole number, for a full match based on the int value of id. If no matches are found, an error message pops up to tell the user, and the table is filled with all product objects within the inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - An enter key press ideally

      • addPart

        private void addPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Opens the AddPart screen within the application. Gives the addPartButton functionality.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • addProduct

        private void addProduct​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        Opens the AddProduct screen within the application. Gives the addProductButton functionality.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • modifyPart

        private void modifyPart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        If a Part object is selected within the partTable, this method opens the ModifyPart screen and passes to its controller the selected part. This gives the modifyPartButton functionality. If no part is selected/highlighted, an error message alerts the user that no part is selected to be modified.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • modifyProduct

        private void modifyProduct​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        If a Product object is selected within the productTable, this method opens the ModifyProduct screen and passes to its controller the selected product. This gives the modifyProductButton functionality. If no product is selected/highlighted, an error message alerts the user that no product is selected to be modified.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • deletePart

        private void deletePart​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        If a Part object is selected within the partTable, this method deletes the part from the inventory. This gives the deletePartButton functionality. If no part is selected/highlighted, an error message alerts the user that no part is selected to be deleted. Before deletion, the user must confirm their choice through a confirmation window before the part is deleted from the inventory.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • deleteProduct

        private void deleteProduct​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        If a Product object is selected within the productTable, this method deletes the product from the inventory. This gives the deleteProductButton functionality. If no product is selected/highlighted, an error message alerts the user that no product is selected to be deleted. If the product has associated parts, a confirmation window forces the user to confirm that they do wish to delete the part, despite parts being associated with it. If the product has no associated parts, the user must still confirm deletion before deletion from the inventory will actually take effect.
        Parameters:
        event - A mouse click

      • errorWindow

        private void errorWindow​(int type)
        Throws error messages if the modify or delete buttons are clicked if their respective inventories are empty, or if there is nothing selected within their respective TableViews.
        Parameters:
        type - The error type to be shown to the user

      • areYouSureWindow

        private boolean areYouSureWindow​(java.lang.String name)
        Confirmation windows when the user wishes to delete a Part or Product.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the object being removed from the inventory
        Returns:
        Returns true if the user selects ok, returns false if the user selects cancel

      • errorAlertWindow

        private boolean errorAlertWindow​(java.lang.String name)
        An alert when the user attempts to delete a Product with associated Part objects.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Product to be deleted
        Returns:
        returns true if the user clicks ok, returns false if the user clicks cancel
